t: Romans 10
Righteousness by Faith Alone
Brothers*p and sisters, my heart’s desire and prayer to God concerning them is for their salvation.
I can testify about them that they have zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.
Since they are ignorant of the righteousness of God and attempted to establish their own righteousness, they have not submitted to God’s righteousness.
For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to everyone who believes,
since Moses writes about the righteousness that is from the law: The*i one*i who*i does*i these*i things*i will*i live*i by*i them.*i
But the righteousness that comes from faith speaks like this: Do*i not*i say*i in*i your*i heart,*i “Who*i will*i go*i up*i to*i heaven?”*i that is, to bring Christ down
or, “Who*i will*i go*i down*i into*i the*i abyss?”*i that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.
On the contrary, what does it say? The*i message*i is*i near*i you,*i in*i your*i mouth*i and*i in*i your*i heart.*i This is the message of faith that we proclaim:
If you confess with your mouth, “Jesus is Lord,” and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
One believes with the heart, resulting in righteousness, and one confesses with the mouth, resulting in salvation.
For the Scripture says, Everyone*i who*i believes*i on*i him*i will*i not*i be*i put*i to*i shame,*i
since there is no distinction between Jew and Greek, because the same Lord of all richly blesses all who call on him.
For everyone*i who*i calls*i on*i the*i name*i of*i the*i Lord*i will*i be*i saved.*i
Israel’s Rejection of the Message
How,*p then, can they call on him they have not believed in? And how can they believe without hearing about him? And how can they hear without a preacher?
And how can they preach unless they are sent? As it is written: How*i beautiful*i are*i the*i feet*i of*i those*i who*i bring*i good*i news.*i
But not all obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says, Lord,*i who*i has*i believed*i our*i message?*i
So faith comes from what is heard, and what is heard comes through the message about Christ.
But I ask, “Did they not hear?” Yes, they did: Their*ipn voice*i has*i gone*i out*i to*i the*i whole*i earth,*i and*iln their*i words*i to*i the*i ends*i of*i the*i world.*i

But*p I ask, “Did Israel not understand?” First, Moses said, I*ipn will*i make*i you*i jealous*i of*iln those*i who*i are*i not*i a*i nation;*i I*iln will*i make*i you*i angry*i by*i a*i nation*i that*iln lacks*i understanding.*i
And*p Isaiah says boldly, I*ipn was*i found*i by*iln those*i who*i were*i not*i looking*i for*i me;*i I*iln revealed*i myself*i to*iln those*i who*i were*i not*i asking*i for*i me.*i
But*p to Israel he says, All*i day*i long*i I*i have*i held*i out*i my*i hands*i to*i a*i disobedient*i and*i defiant*i people.*i
